content.description: Sit start below the lowest good jug. Left hand sidepull w/ thumb pocket, right hand in a double hueco. Move up to the first good jug, then up and right through pockets to the crimpy ledge. Up and right some more through good pockets to a minty but thorny top out. Beware of loose blocks up there.
content.location: Sandscape is located on the Pelo del Perro boulder down the north trail.

content.description: Sit start beneath a sloper and move up through pockets, past a ledge and left around the tree to top out, which is the crux.
content.location: Located on the Pelo del Perro boulder's south face, around the corner left of Sandscape. Underneath a tree that contacts the rock.

content.description: Arete to the right of Sandscape.  Sit-start on the two obvious pockets on the right slab face and make your way up the arete using more pockets and a heel hook or two, while staying off the slab to the right.  The top-out is pretty simple, but be delicate - the bomberness of the shelves is questionable.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter if truly desired, landing is good.
content.location: On the northeast arete of the Pelo del Perro boulder, directions on main page.

content.description: Start low (beneath the small cave with bones in it) and move up and left through roof or along the juggy arete. The roof pulls over into more vertical but vegetated climbing. The shortest downclimb is on the opposite side of the boulder.
content.protection: Pretty rocky here, might be worth bringing two pads
content.location: Located on the Pelo del Perro boulder's NW corner. To reach this boulder, follow the directions under the area's "Getting There" section.

content.description: This place has some cool problems, but be careful when topping out most of them as the rock isn't super solid. The best downclimb is the dirty slab on the north face above [Sladam's Route], it helps to have climbed up it before.
